privacy.title: Privacy Policy
privacy.section1Text: We collect information you provide directly to us, including your name, email address, and tree plantation data (photos, location, species). We use Google OAuth for authentication and do not store your password.
privacy.section2List1: Verify and track your environmental contributions.
privacy.section2List2: Calculate and display your oxygen impact.
privacy.section2List3: Maintain the public leaderboard (displaying your name and aggregate impact).
privacy.section2List4: Improve our AI models for tree recognition.
privacy.section3Text: We do not sell your personal data. We may share aggregated, anonymized environmental data with researchers or partners. Your individual contribution details (tree photo, rough location) may be visible publicly on the platform to verify impact.
privacy.section4Text: You verified users can request the deletion of their account and associated personal data by contacting us. Some contribution data may be retained in an anonymized format to maintain the integrity of our environmental records.
privacy.section5Text: If you have any questions about this Privacy Policy, please contact us at https://github.com/manasdutta04/vayura

terms.title: Terms of Service
terms.section1Text: By accessing and using Vayura ("the Platform"), you agree to comply with and be bound by these Terms of Service. If you do not agree to these terms, please do not use our services.
terms.section2Text: Vayura provides a platform for tracking tree plantations, estimating oxygen impact, and connecting users with environmental NGOs. The impact metrics provided are estimates based on available scientific data and AI analysis.
terms.section3Text: Users are responsible for the accuracy of information submitted, including tree plantation photos and location data. We reserve the right to verify, reject, or remove contributions that violate our guidelines or appear fraudulent.
terms.section4Text: By submitting photos to Vayura, you grant us a non-exclusive, worldwide, royalty-free license to use, display, and reproduce the content for the purpose of operating and promoting the platform and its environmental mission.
terms.section5Text: Vayura is provided "as is" without warranties of any kind. We are not liable for any damages arising from your use of the platform or reliance on the environmental data provided.

dataPolicy.title: Data Policy & Transparency
dataPolicy.subtitle: We believe in radical transparency. Here's exactly where our data comes from and how we handle your information.
dataPolicy.scientificNoteText: While we strive for accuracy, environmental data involves complex calculations. Metrics like "Monthly Oxygen Output" and "CO₂ Offset" are estimates based on average tree species performance in Indian climates. Actual results may vary based on exact species, soil health, and local weather conditions.
dataPolicy.publicContributionsDesc: To maintain integrity, your tree plantation stats (number of trees, approximate location context) are public on the leaderboard.
dataPolicy.dataProtectionDesc: We never sell your personal data. Your email is used solely for secure authentication and critical account updates.
dataPolicy.openSourceDesc: Our code and methods are open source on GitHub. You can inspect exactly how we handle data and calculate impact.
dataPolicy.source1Desc: Official forest cover and tree data from Ministry of Environment, Forest and Climate Change.
dataPolicy.source2Desc: Real-time air quality data including AQI, PM2.5, PM10, and other pollutant concentrations.
dataPolicy.source3Desc: Population density and demographic data used for per-capita impact calculations.
dataPolicy.source4Desc: Published AQI averages and historical pollution data for Indian districts.
dataPolicy.source5Desc: Advanced data aggregation and environmental impact estimation where direct sensor data is unavailable.

methodology.title: Methodology
methodology.subtitle: Transparent oxygen calculation methodology for expert review and community trust

overview.title: Overview
overview.p1: Vayura uses a science-based methodology to calculate oxygen demand and supply at the state and district level. Our approach combines population data, environmental factors, and tree oxygen production to provide actionable insights.
overview.p2: This page documents our calculation methodology to enable expert review, ensure transparency, and build trust in our open-source platform.

demand.title: Oxygen Demand Calculation
demand.formula: O₂ Demand = Population × Daily O₂ × 365 × Conversion × Penalty
demand.penaltyDesc: These multipliers account for increased oxygen needs due to pollution, soil degradation, and natural disasters.
demand.penaltyCalc: AQI Factor × Soil Factor × Disaster Factor

supply.title: Oxygen Supply Calculation
supply.formula: O₂ Supply = Total Trees × Base Production × Soil Adjustment
supply.soilAdjDesc: Tree oxygen production is adjusted based on soil quality:
supply.soilAdjNote: This ensures that even poor soil (below 70% quality) allows trees to produce at least 70% of their base oxygen output.

dataSources.title: Data Sources
dataSources.populationDesc: Census of India (latest available district-level data)
dataSources.forestDesc: Forest Survey of India (FSI) - State of Forest Report
dataSources.treeIdentificationDesc: AI-powered image analysis using Google Gemini Vision
dataSources.soilDisasterDesc: Default regional estimates - Pending integration with government databases

limitations.title: Known Limitations
limitations.acknowledge: We acknowledge the following limitations in our current methodology:
limitations.simplifiedDesc: Current penalty factors are broad estimates and don't capture hyperlocal variations.
limitations.defaultAqiDesc: We currently use a default AQI of 100 (Moderate). Real-time AQI integration is planned.
limitations.aiEstimationDesc: Tree age and health assessments use AI inference, which may have accuracy limitations.
limitations.speciesVarianceDesc: The base 110 kg/year is an average. Actual O₂ production varies by species, age, and health.
limitations.seasonalDesc: Our annual calculations don't account for seasonal changes in photosynthesis rates.

footer.review: This methodology is open for community review and improvement.
